item.title: Variadic Functions in Go
item.description: What are variadic functions? Variadic functions are functions that can be called with any number of trailing arguments. In Golang, fmt.Println is a common variadic function. fmt.Println("hello") // prints hello fmt.Println("hello ", "world", 4, 2) // prints hello world 4 2 How to write variadic functions? To declare a variadic function, the type of the last argument is prefixed with ..., which shows that this function can be called with any number of arguments of the same type. func sum(nums ...int) int { total := 0 for _, v := range nums { total += v } return total } func main() { fmt.
